title: Sheepy
author: Sheepy
created_time: March 21, 2023, 01:45:03 PMLast edit: March 04, 2024, 10:49:25 AM by Sheepy
content: Sheepy is a cryptocurrency payment gateway that allows merchants to accept various digital currencies and handle large volumes of crypto payments.The platform is an easy, powerful, and secure solution for accepting stablecoins such as Tether (USDT), USD Coin (USDC) as well as Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), XRP, and many more. Withdrawals with SEPA transfers are available for anyone with EU/EEA bank accounts.Sheepy partners with PrestaShop, integrating its advanced cryptocurrency payment gateway into PrestaShop's e-commerce platform, enabling seamless digital currency transactions for online merchants.The Sheepy payment module, specifically designed for PrestaShop, introduces a hassle-free approach for merchants to incorporate cryptocurrency as a payment option. Reflecting Sheepy‚Äôs commitment to innovation and user empowerment, the module boasts real-time exchange rate updates and a suite of features including API access, comprehensive transaction tracking, and custom invoice creation, alongside convenient auto-withdrawals.Expanding its suite of solutions, Sheepy now offers the Mass Payouts feature, streamlining the process for businesses to execute bulk payments in cryptocurrency. This is particularly beneficial for companies that need to make numerous payouts simultaneously, offering them a cost-effective, secure, and efficient way to manage their disbursements.Furthermore, Sheepy has introduced a new onramp solution tailored for iGaming merchants. This solution is designed to facilitate the easy, fast, and secure onboarding of players into the iGaming ecosystem, enabling them to deposit funds using cryptocurrencies. This addition not only enhances the payment options available for iGaming platforms but also opens up new avenues for user engagement and retention by leveraging the growing popularity and acceptance of digital currencies in the online gaming industry.Create an account, verify it and start getting paid for your goods and services in cryptocurrency. Receive payments to your crypto wallet or convert to fiat.Learn more about our product features or schedule a call here.

comments.author: Sheepy
comments.created_time: March 24, 2023, 10:32:52 AMLast edit: March 27, 2023, 01:59:21 PM by Sheepy
comments.body: Hello guys! Of course, we are a regulated fintech business and have certain limitations in terms of counties and territories. This is relevant for our merchants but not customers who would like to pay using our payment gateway. The same relates to KYC which is the current market standard for all legit crypto businesses. However, we are committed to enhancing the process with automated checks, monitoring tools and public databases.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: Sheepy on March 24, 2023, 10:32:52 AMOf course, we are a regulated fintech business and have certain limitations in terms of counties and territories. This is relevant for our merchants but not customers who would like to pay using our payment gateway. Can you at least explain why those jurisdictions are prohibited? I'm seeing countries like Malaysia, Indonesia, etc. What is the legal rule or regulation that you refer to when you ban them? IIRC, other payment gateways don't prohibit users (business owners or buyers) from those countries from using their services, so it looks odd to me. From a quick glance, it seems like you prohibit business owners from countries where using crypto as a payment option is not legal.

In general, financial regulations and compliance requirements can vary greatly across different jurisdictions. Some countries have stricter regulations when it comes to cryptocurrency payments, and we, as a payment gateway, may also have our internal policies and risk appetite assessments that determine which countries or regions are considered high-risk for crypto payments.

comments.body: Quote from: Sheepy on March 27, 2023, 09:38:14 AMYes, you are right. In general, financial regulations and compliance requirements can vary greatly across different jurisdictions. Some countries have stricter regulations when it comes to cryptocurrency payments, and we, as a payment gateway,Most, if not all, financial legislation is strict for amounts that exceed the amount of one thousand or two thousand dollars, and most payments to merchants are less than that amount. Therefore, there is no need for strictness for depositors, and perhaps the necessary strictness for stores, as the total of their transfers will definitely be more than a thousand dollars.Many countries do not have clear legislation for encrypted currencies, and therefore, as long as the transfer does not contain US dollars, most of these legislations are useless.Isn't this a bad choice for users? Where anyone can know my daily store deposit and thus estimate what I can buy.
